intro: Lepidium pedersenii, commonly known as the Andean cress, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as broccoli and cabbage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a compact, cushion-like growth habit. Its leaves are often hairy and have a peppery flavor, similar to other members of its family. Lepidium pedersenii is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine regions.
